column4: i just did a system update and my volume thing, thing still is not working
anyone have any info on the volume thing thing on the panel
Could you be a little more specific, please?
alsamixer from the terminal doesn't work??
g++ on its own is just used from the terminal (Applications->Accessories->Terminal). Example g++ <source_filename> will compile single source files.
bah, sorry
If you please, we need to know if you've gone into the terminal and tried alsamixer.
Applications->Accessories->Terminal. Type alsamixer. Use the arrow keys to move left and right, and adjust the level bars up and down.
i did and nothing adjusts
What does it say for card and chip?
analog f does adjust volume
card:  CA0106 ///// chip is blank
that's what I figured
Truth be told, given the value of card in Alsamixer, I'd almost suggest buying a separate card, perhaps one that's more of a mainstream brand.
i just installed ubuntu a week ago and reinstalled it. when i came on to this chat room someone gave me the solution in matter of mins. i just dont rememeber all the steps the dude gave me
its not the soundcard its a soundblaster which apparently ubuntu supports
That IS a soundcard in my vocabulary. So, it's a soundblaster, what model?
soundblaster xtreme fidelity
its not the soundcard, at least i dont think it is, its more of the program and the settings of the volume panel. what i need to configure to make it work so it can adjust volume
true enough
Are you on a 32 or 64-bit system?
64, i think
There is a blog post that says there are alsa compatible drivers for your line on 64-bit........
